attachments.title: Al Jazeera | Life on Hold
attachments.text: Al Jazeera’s immersive, interactive video experience Life on Hold takes us to Lebanon for a close and personal look at the lives of Syrian refugees. Five years of unrelenting violence across Syria has claimed close to 200,000 lives. Towns and cities have been laid to waste. Over three million refugees have poured across Syria’s borders into neighbouring countries, desperate for safety. Lebanon has borne the brunt of this forced migration.. Life on Hold takes you inside the world of a diverse group of refugees; revealing their deep sense of loss and fragile hope for the future.
attachments.fallback: Life on Hold: Al Jazeera | Life on Hold

text: interesting
Pretty interesting.
Also a good case against pre-loaders.
I love the content, but I gotta say - Im not in love with the design on the whole
<@U02618EV1>, what do you mean?
well - I love the stories they’re telling
but I don’t like the design of the site
oh
ha
It’s a lot of waiting just so I can see the content. From a user perspective I see numbers being increased with no context while I see the loader.
that was for gaston
Im dumb

That’s why I typically recommend lazy-loading things over preloading. Gives the user the ability to scroll through the content to gain some context while things load if they’re in a slow connection area.

yeah, i feel like it’s a super super heavy site overall. Animations, density of stuff, etc. I’d probably disagree that it’s a case against pre-loaders across the board though… we found some really great examples that are using that technique really well.
but, it’s also interesting to see how they’re using a pretty western aesthetic with color and type.
i think this site is a great example of letting the design upstage the content
too heavy handed - reduces the impact of the actual stories

The trend I’ve seen lately is content sites using lazy-load while full-blown experiences (museums, games, etc) using pre-load. I think the rationale behind that is that you may jump from story to story so you may have to wait for preloaders more than once while on games or full experiences you load the thing once and enjoy it while you’re on the site.
I think my vision is permanently impaired from all of that text over text.
really chugging on my computer.
